td.style: padding: 0px 18px 9px;color: #616661;font-family: Arial, "Helvetica Neue", Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 11px;font-style: normal;font-weight: normal;line-height: 125%;text-align: right;mso-line-height-rule: exactly;-ms-text-size-adjust: 100%;-webkit-text-size-adjust: 100%;word-break: break-word;

h4.style: display: block;margin: 0;padding: 0;color: #616661;font-family: Helvetica;font-size: 14px;font-style: normal;font-weight: normal;line-height: 125%;letter-spacing: normal;text-align: left;

span.span:
Dear Woodside School Families,
I hope that you are well and are adjusting to this new normal that we are all experiencing.
Late this afternoon, State Superintendent of Public Instruction Thurmond shared a public statement stating that students will not be able to return to school campuses for the rest of this school year. In his letter, the State Superintendent emphasizes the need to continue efforts to implement distance learning and other issues that address the needs of students and the community. Also, here is the press release from the San Mateo County Office of Education.

h4.style: display: block;margin: 0;padding: 0;color: #616661;font-family: Helvetica;font-size: 14px;font-style: normal;font-weight: normal;line-height: 125%;letter-spacing: normal;text-align: left;

span.span:
I remain confident that our community will continue to work in partnership to support our students for the remainder of this school year. I am grateful for each and every student, staff member, parent, guardian, and community member for going above and beyond to take on the many challenges of this unprecedented pandemic. These are challenging times for everyone, and as we complete our last week of instruction before spring break, I want to thank you all.
In addition, the County extended the shelter-in-place order until May 3. This means that the current guidelines that everyone is following will be extended for the entire month of April and into May. They will begin to evaluate if the May 3rd date is firm or if it will need to be extended as we approach the middle of April. Please continue to follow the social distancing guidelines as there is some early data that suggests that it may be working!

h4.style: display: block;margin: 0;padding: 0;color: #616661;font-family: Helvetica;font-size: 14px;font-style: normal;font-weight: normal;line-height: 125%;letter-spacing: normal;text-align: left;

span.span: Please stay tuned for more information.

h4.style: display: block;margin: 0;padding: 0;color: #616661;font-family: Helvetica;font-size: 14px;font-style: normal;font-weight: normal;line-height: 125%;letter-spacing: normal;text-align: left;
display: block;margin: 0;padding: 0;color: #616661;font-family: Helvetica;font-size: 14px;font-style: normal;font-weight: normal;line-height: 125%;letter-spacing: normal;text-align: left;

span.br:
Woodside School District
3195 Woodside Road
Woodside, CA 94062
650-851-1571
